description: Robbers broke into the Crosland Moor store at 6.40 am on May 5 to target a cash machine. West Yorkshire Police has now revealed three men got away with £60,000, that it is thought was being deposited by a cash in transit team before the store opened. Ben Dyer, 27, from Osmondthorpe was sentenced at Leeds Crown Court yesterday after pleading guilty to the robbery at...
text:
One of the culprits behind a daring daylight raid at a Huddersfield Co-op
supermarket has been jailed.

Robbers broke into the Crosland Moor store at 6.40am on May 5 to target a cash
machine.

West Yorkshire Police has now revealed three men got away with £60,000, that
it is thought was being deposited by a cash in transit team before the store
opened.

A Leeds man has now been sentenced to six years in prison after admitting his
part in a high value robbery.

Ben Dyer, 27, from Osmondthorpe was sentenced at Leeds Crown Court yesterday
(June 4) after pleading guilty to the robbery at the store on Park Road West.

The court heard Dyer, who pleaded guilty to robbery and aggravated burglary,
was one of three men who broke into the store while Co-op staff and cash in
transit (CIT) officers were present.

Detectives from Kirklees District CID are continuing enquiries into the raid
and have so far recovered a substantial amount of the stolen cash.

PC Callum Watson of Kirklees CID, said: "We welcome the sentencing of Dyer for
his part in what was a high value theft on a local business.

"Although no-one was hurt in the raid, this would clearly have been a very
distressing incident for staff and CIT officers inside the shop.

"We are continuing to investigate this very serious robbery and are pursuing
lines of enquiry."

title: One of three behind £60,000 Huddersfield Co-op cash heist caught and jailed
html:
One of the culprits behind a daring daylight raid at a Huddersfield Co-op supermarket has been jailed.

Robbers broke into the Crosland Moor store at 6.40am on May 5 to target a cash machine.

West Yorkshire Police has now revealed three men got away with £60,000, that it is thought was being deposited by a cash in transit team before the store opened.

A Leeds man has now been sentenced to six years in prison after admitting his part in a high value robbery.

Ben Dyer, 27, from Osmondthorpe was sentenced at Leeds Crown Court yesterday (June 4) after pleading guilty to the robbery at the store on Park Road West.

The court heard Dyer, who pleaded guilty to robbery and aggravated burglary, was one of three men who broke into the store while Co-op staff and cash in transit (CIT) officers were present.

Detectives from Kirklees District CID are continuing enquiries into the raid and have so far recovered a substantial amount of the stolen cash.

PC Callum Watson of Kirklees CID, said: "We welcome the sentencing of Dyer for his part in what was a high value theft on a local business.

"Although no-one was hurt in the raid, this would clearly have been a very distressing incident for staff and CIT officers inside the shop.

"We are continuing to investigate this very serious robbery and are pursuing lines of enquiry."
